success.description: The index.md should have a  '## Additional resources' section containing the project files section.  This section should include any additional links that will be useful for the blueprint.
Image links in the README.md file should point to a valid image file.

fileHighlights.lineContent: ![GCSDK_Angular](blueprint/images/overview.png "Develop an Angular app that uses the Genesys Cloud Platform SDK")

success.description: The index.md file must have a '## Prerequisites' section that describes the skillset and technical requirements an individual must have to successfully install the blueprint.
The index.md must have a '## Solution' section describing how blueprint solves the project.
The index.md must have a '## Content' section linking to the rest of the document.
The index.md file should have a '## Implementation steps' section that enumerates the steps necessary to carry out the blueprint implementation.
The index.md file should have '### Specialized knowledge' section that enumerates the skill sets that the implementor should possess in order to carry out the blueprint.
The index.md file's front matter must include the following fields: title, author, indextype, icon, image, category, and summary

fileHighlights.lineContent: title: Develop a Vue App that provides basic agent monitoring functionality

success.description: Every Genesys Cloud blueprint should have a overview.png file that contains a high-level architecture diagram for the blueprint.
Every Genesys Cloud blueprint should have a blueprint directory at the root of the project.  This directory should hold all assets associated with the blueprint.
Image links in the README.md file is missing alternative text.
Every Genesys Cloud blueprint should have a blueprint/images directory that will contain all of the image assets for a project.
Overview image should be referred to in README.MD

fileHighlights.lineContent: ![GCSDK_Angular](blueprint/images/overview.png "Develop an Angular app that uses the Genesys Cloud Platform SDK")

success.description: The front matter must be defined in the file or the blueprint will not appear in the Developer Center

fileHighlights.lineContent:
---
title: Develop a Vue App that provides basic agent monitoring functionality
author: prince.merluza
indextype: blueprint
icon: blueprint
image: images/cover.png
category: 6
summary: |
  This Genesys Cloud Developer Blueprint demonstrates how to to include the Genesys Cloud Javascript Platform SDK in a Vue project. The blueprint includes a sample Vue project that uses the Genesys Cloud API for basic supervisor functionality of monitoring agent statuses.
---

failed.description: The index.md must have a '## Scenario' section describing the problem the blueprint is trying to solve.
All Genesys Cloud blueprints must include a README.MD file.  This file should contain a brief introduction of the blueprint.
Every Genesys Cloud blueprint should have a blueprint/index.md that contains a complete writeup in Markdown of the blueprint.
The index.md file should have a '### Download the repository containing the project files' section that describe how to clone the blueprint repository from GitHub.
